shootergame.interactor

Class HitEnemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • city.cs.engine.Body
      • city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
        • city.cs.engine.Walker
          • shootergame.interactor.Enemy
            • shootergame.interactor.HitEnemy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    city.cs.engine.CollisionListener, city.cs.engine.SensorListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class HitEnemy
extends Enemy
implements city.cs.engine.SensorListener, city.cs.engine.CollisionListener
    The Enemy that follows the player and attacks at close proximity. Parent class is Enemy.

      • HitEnemy

        public HitEnemy(city.cs.engine.World world,
                Player player,
                MachineGun mg,
                Pistol p,
                Shotgun s)
         throws javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                java.io.IOException,
                javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Parameters:
        world - World the Enemy will be in.
        player - Player the enemy will attack.
        mg - MG weapon.
        p - Pistol Weapon.
        s - Shotgun Weapon.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - If an unsupported audio file is played.
        java.io.IOException - If there's an error with the IO.
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - when .getLine() fails.

      • beginContact

        public void beginContact(city.cs.engine.SensorEvent e)
        Description copied from class: Enemy
        Sensors that determine the direction the enemy will be facing. The direction is determined via the position of the player and enemy.

      • collide

        public void collide(city.cs.engine.CollisionEvent e)
        Description copied from class: Enemy
        Listens for when a Bullet hits the shape of the Enemy. Then checks for the weapon the player currently hold, finally takes away an amount of health depending on the weapon the player is holding currently. If Health equals or less than 0 then the Enemy gets destroyed.
        Specified by:
        collide in interface city.cs.engine.CollisionListener
        Overrides:
        collide in class Enemy
        Parameters:
        e - CollisionEvent
